result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Esther Teegarden

records.addlTxt: Statement of Read-In  to the record in Dunn County cases 21CF237, 21CF240, 22CF124 for purposes of sentencing, attachment of jeopardy and restitution. Filed by ADA Becker. arc

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Melissa M. Petersen appears via zoom  DF:  Melissa Esther Teegarden appeared in custody via zoom from Dunn County Jail. Case called at 8:56 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for an arraignment. Atty Petersen has received a copy of the information. DE understands charges and penalties. NG plea to all charges. There is a resolution. Waiting on Dunn County resolution. ADA Becker states this matter would be dismissed and read in to Dunn County sentencing. Currently scheduled for August 22. Court will set for an internal review for August 26 and expect to receive the consent to consolidate paperwork by then. If nothing is received, JA will reach out for further scheduling. Court adjourned at 9:00 a.m.

Arraignment on June 8, 2022 at 08:45 am.

* Mailed to DE @ Dunn County Jail * hml

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Melissa M. Petersen appears via zoom   DF:  Melissa Esther Teegarden did not appear. Case called at 8:31 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for an arraignment. DE does not appear. Atty Petersen states DE is currently in the Dunn County Jail. Not sure why she is not on zoom. There is a resolution. ADA Becker has been in contact with Dunn County DA's Office and working towards a resolution. Court will schedule for arraignment. Will have JA coordinate zoom appearance. Court adjourned at 8:35 a.m.  Arraignment scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:45 am.

for continuance of 5/11 ARGN. Filed by Atty Petersen. km
Per RMW: zoom approved. JA advised atty. tfy/km

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Melissa M. Petersen   DF:  Melissa Esther Teegarden appeared via zoom from Dunn County Jail. Case called at 11:17 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a preliminary hearing. Atty Petersen states it will be a waiver. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. DE understands and waives right to preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. ADA Becker requesting matter be scheduled out for arraignment. Court schedules. Zoom approved for DE and Atty Petersen. Court adjourned at 11:22 a.m.  Arraignment scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

for Defendant to appear via Zoom for 4/26 PH. Filed by Atty M. Petersen. km 
Per RMW: Zoom approved. JA scheduled zoom appearance with Dunn Co. tfy/km
Preliminary hearing on April 26, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Filed by Atty Petersen. arc   e: DA
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 26, 2022 at 11:15 am.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY: Kaitlin Dippolito and Abrianna Dolfi   DF:  Melissa Esther Teegarden appeared in custody via video. DE has a copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed. Understands charges and penalties. Waives further reading. Qualifies for PD services. Atty Dippolito states Atty Petersen will be appointed on this file.  ADA Becker states DE is currently on a PO HOLD. Court will have JA contact Atty Petersen for further scheduling. Court will find good cause for exceeding time limits on preliminary hearing for appointment of counsel.
